greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: partial column sums of the triangle of natural numbers (written sequentially by rows).
comment: T(n,k) is the n-th partial sum of the k-th column of the triangle of natural numbers.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
formula: As infinite lower triangular matrices, A000012 * A000027.
example: First few rows of the triangle:
These are the partial sums of the columns of the triangle:
program: { for(n=1, 10, for(k=1, n, print1(T(n,k), ", ")); print) } \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 18 2021
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, May 23 2010
ext: Name changed and terms a(56) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 18 2021
